title: 91/650/EEC: Commission Decision of 10 December 1991 on the establishment of an addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in Ireland on the improvement of the conditions under which agricultural products are processed and marketed (Only the English text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 10 December 1991  on the establishment of an addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in Ireland on the improvement of the conditions under which agricultural products are processed  and marketed  (Only the English text is authentic)  (91/650/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The addendum to the Community support framework for Community structural assistance on the improvement of the conditions under which agricultural products are processed and marketed in Ireland covering the period 1 January 1991 to 31 December  1993, is hereby established.
The Commission declares that it intends to contribute to the implementation of this addendum to the Community support framework in accordance with the detailed provisions thereof and in compliance with the rules and guidelines of the Stuctural Funds and  the other existing financial instruments.

The addendum to the Community support framework contains the following essential information:
(a) a statement of the main priorities for joint action in the following sectors:
1. Meat
2. Milk and milk products
3. Eggs and poultry
4. Livestock: sundry
5. Cereals
6. Fruit and vegetables
7. Flowers and plants
8. Potatoes
9. Crops: sundry;
(b) an indicative financing plan specifying, at constant 1991 prices, the total cost of the priorities adopted for joint action by the Community and the Member State concerned, ECU 142 246 000 for the whole period, and the financial arrangements  envisaged for budgetary assistance from the Community, broken down as follows:
(in ecus)
1. Meat 28 652 000
2. Milk and milk products 6 000 000
3. Eggs and poultry 9 106 000
4. Livestock: sundry 2 000 000
5. Cereals 1 852 000
6. Fruit and vegetables 3 200 000
7. Flowers and plants 278 000
8. Potatoes 2 500 000
9. Crops: sundry 185 000
Total 53 773 000
The resultant national financing requirement, approximately ECU 18 847 000 for the public sector and ECU 69 626 000 for the private sector, may be partially covered by Community loans from the European Investment Bank and the other loan instruments.
This declaration of intent is addressed to Ireland.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 10 December 1991. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
